Headline: Seph Lawless' images show America's deserted malls
Article_Body: A photo from inside Ohio's Rolling Acres Mall, which closed in 2008. Scroll through to see more of Seph Lawless' images of abandoned shopping centers.  The Metro North Mall in Kansas City North, Missouri, was demolished in 2017, shortly after Lawless documented its remains. The Northridge Mall in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, was opened in the 1970s during America's retail boom. Like many malls in the US, the Hampton Square Mall in Essexville, Michigan, closed in the aftermath of the Great Recession of the late 2000s. A disused merry-go-round at the shuttered Medley Center Mall in Irondequoit, a suburb of Rochester, New York.  The Jamestown Mall in Florissant, Missouri, closed in 2014 after almost 40 years in business.  The Hawthorne Plaza Shopping Center in Hawthorne, California, has been used as a film set for a number of movies and TV shows. Demolition work on the Lincoln Mall in Matteson, Illinois, has commenced since Lawless' visit. The site of the Owings Mills Mall in Owings Mills, Maryland, has since been used for a shopping, dining and entertainment complex. The site of Ohio's Randall Park Mall, where Lawless spent time as a child, has since been used for an Amazon warehouse.  A US flag still hangs at Arizona's Fiesta Mall, which closed its doors in early 2018. Lenoir Mall in North Carolina is one of more than 20 "dead" malls featured in Lawless' new book "Abandoned Malls of America."
